intro: Calyptrostegia trichostachya, commonly known as the velvetleaf or wild cotton, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, fluffy seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Calyptrostegia trichostachya is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands. It has a fibrous root system and is adapted to thrive in warm, humid climates.
